N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 702.4 - Restraint of defendant

State Regulations
(a) If a defendant engages in
disruptive conduct in the course of the trial and the trial judge determines
not to take action under the preceding sections, he may order the defendant to
be physically restrained in the courtroom while his trial continues. (b) However, the trial judge
shall not direct the restraint authorized in the preceding subdivision unless
he shall have first warned the defendant, following his disruptive conduct, that any further misconduct by him will lead to his physical restraint in the
courtroom. (c) The
physical restraint of the defendant shall be terminated immediately upon a
determination by the court that the defendant is not likely to engage in
further disruptive conduct. Notes
